fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Trade, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence
inter_groups: Cooperation with the intergroup FREEDOM OF RELIGION OR BELIEF AND RELIGIOUS TOLERANCE. Interacting with ideas and proposals to promote cohesive ideas for developing basic human rights.
eu_initiatives:
The Foundation particularly follow policies and initiatives that concern Christian minorities in the EU.  
 
Legislation currently followed. 
1) Fundamental Rights Colloquium by DG Justice EC 
2) 2008/0140(APP) Equal treatment: implementing the principle of equal treatment between persons irrespective of religion or belief, disability, age or sexual orientation. 
3) Doc 11855/12 Human Rights and Democracy: EU Strategic Framework and EU Action Plan. 
 
We also follow any initiatives or legislation that deals with human-rights and anti-discriminatory proposals that affect religious minorities.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar

legal_status: Registered charitable non-profit organisation in Sweden
goals__remit: To promote the rights and freedoms of Christian minority groups; and to help develop good policies and legislation based on moral values for the benefit of all. The Foundation makes submissions to both the European Parliament and the European Commission, engaging in the public consultative process and often attends public hearings at Brussels where it presents fact-based evidence on situations through Europe as to minority groups.
